verses.kjv: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet upon Shigionoth.
verses.web: A prayer of Habakkuk, the prophet, set to victorious music.
verses.ct: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, set to passionate music.

verses.kjv: O LORD, I have heard thy speech, and was afraid: O LORD, revive thy work in the midst of the years, in the midst of the years make known; in wrath remember mercy.
verses.web: LORD, I have heard of your fame. I stand in awe of your deeds, LORD. Renew your work in the middle of the years. In the middle of the years make it known. In wrath, you remember mercy.
verses.ct: LORD, I have heard about what you've done, and I stand in awe. LORD, bring your mighty work back to life in our own time — make it known in our generation. Even in your wrath, remember mercy.

verses.kjv: God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.
verses.web: God came from Teman, the Holy One from Mount Paran. His glory covered the heavens, and his praise filled the earth.
verses.ct: God came from Teman, the Holy One from Mount Paran. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was filled with his praise.

verses.kjv: And his brightness was as the light; he had horns coming out of his hand: and there was the hiding of his power.
verses.web: His splendor is like the sunrise. Rays shine from his hand, where his power is hidden.
verses.ct: His brightness blazed like the sunrise. Rays of light flashed from his hand, and there his power was hidden.

verses.kjv: Before him went the pestilence, and burning coals went forth at his feet.
verses.web: Plague went before him, and pestilence followed his feet.
verses.ct: Plague marched ahead of him, and pestilence followed at his feet.

verses.kjv: He stood, and measured the earth: he beheld, and drove asunder the nations; and the everlasting mountains were scattered, the perpetual hills did bow: his ways are everlasting.
verses.web: He stood, and shook the earth. He looked, and made the nations tremble. The ancient mountains were crumbled. The age-old hills collapsed. His ways are eternal.
verses.ct: He stood and shook the earth. He looked and made the nations tremble. The ancient mountains crumbled, and the age-old hills collapsed — yet his ways are eternal.

verses.kjv: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction: and the curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.
verses.web: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction. The dwellings of the land of Midian trembled.
verses.ct: I saw the tents of Cushan in distress, and the dwellings of Midian shook with fear.

verses.kjv: Was the LORD displeased against the rivers? was thine anger against the rivers? was thy wrath against the sea, that thou didst ride upon thine horses and thy chariots of salvation?
verses.web: Was LORD displeased with the rivers? Was your anger against the rivers, or your wrath against the sea, that you rode on your horses, on your chariots of salvation?
verses.ct: Was it the rivers that angered you, LORD? Was your fury aimed at the rivers? Was your wrath against the sea, that you rode out on your horses and your chariots of salvation?

verses.kjv: Thy bow was made quite naked, according to the oaths of the tribes, even thy word. Selah. Thou didst cleave the earth with rivers.
verses.web: You uncovered your bow. You called for your sworn arrows. You split the earth with rivers.
verses.ct: You drew your bow and made it ready, calling for your sworn arrows. You split the earth open with rivers.

verses.kjv: The mountains saw thee, and they trembled: the overflowing of the water passed by: the deep uttered his voice, and lifted up his hands on high.
verses.web: The mountains saw you, and were afraid. The storm of waters passed by. The deep roared and lifted up its hands on high.
verses.ct: The mountains saw you and writhed in fear. Torrents of water swept past. The deep ocean roared and lifted its waves like hands toward the sky.

verses.kjv: The sun and moon stood still in their habitation: at the light of thine arrows they went, and at the shining of thy glittering spear.
verses.web: The sun and moon stood still in the sky, at the light of your arrows as they went, at the shining of your glittering spear.
verses.ct: The sun and moon froze in their places at the flash of your flying arrows, at the gleam of your glittering spear.

verses.kjv: Thou didst march through the land in indignation, thou didst thresh the heathen in anger.
verses.web: You marched through the land in wrath. You threshed the nations in anger.
verses.ct: You marched across the earth in fury. You threshed the nations in anger.

verses.kjv: Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people, even for salvation with thine anointed; thou woundedst the head out of the house of the wicked, by discovering the foundation unto the neck. Selah.
verses.web: You went out for the salvation of your people, for the salvation of your anointed. You crushed the head of the land of wickedness. You stripped them head to foot.
verses.ct: You went out to rescue your people, to bring salvation to your anointed. You crushed the leader of the wicked house, stripping it bare from foundation to rooftop.

verses.kjv: Thou didst strike through with his staves the head of his villages: they came out as a whirlwind to scatter me: their rejoicing was as to devour the poor secretly.
verses.web: You pierced the heads of his warriors with their own spears. They came as a whirlwind to scatter me, gloating as if to devour the wretched in secret.
verses.ct: With their own spears you pierced the heads of their warriors — those who stormed in like a whirlwind to scatter me, gloating as though they could devour the helpless in secret.

verses.kjv: Thou didst walk through the sea with thine horses, through the heap of great waters.
verses.web: You trampled the sea with your horses, churning mighty waters.
verses.ct: You trampled through the sea with your horses, churning the mighty waters.

verses.kjv: When I heard, my belly trembled; my lips quivered at the voice: rottenness entered into my bones, and I trembled in myself, that I might rest in the day of trouble: when he cometh up unto the people, he will invade them with his troops.
verses.web: I heard, and my body trembled. My lips quivered at the voice. Rottenness enters into my bones, and I tremble in my place, because I must wait quietly for the day of trouble, for the coming up of the people who invade us.
verses.ct: When I heard all this, my body trembled. My lips quivered at the sound. My bones felt like they were rotting inside me, and my legs shook beneath me. Yet I will wait quietly for the day of trouble to come — the day when the invader rises against our people.

verses.kjv: Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither shall fruit be in the vines; the labour of the olive shall fail, and the fields shall yield no meat; the flock shall be cut off from the fold, and there shall be no herd in the stalls:
verses.web: For though the fig tree doesn’t flourish, nor fruit be in the vines; the labor of the olive fails, the fields yield no food; the flocks are cut off from the fold, and there is no herd in the stalls:
verses.ct: Even if the fig tree doesn't bloom and the vines produce no grapes, even if the olive crop fails and the fields grow no food, even if the flocks vanish from the pen and no cattle stand in the stalls —

verses.kjv: Yet I will rejoice in the LORD, I will joy in the God of my salvation.
verses.web: yet I will rejoice in LORD. I will be joyful in the God of my salvation!
verses.ct: still, I will rejoice in the LORD! I will find my joy in the God of my salvation!

verses.kjv: The LORD God is my strength, and he will make my feet like hinds’ feet, and he will make me to walk upon mine high places. To the chief singer on my stringed instruments.
verses.web: LORD, the Lord, is my strength. He makes my feet like deer’s feet, and enables me to go in high places. For the music director, on my stringed instruments.
verses.ct: The LORD God is my strength. He makes my feet as sure as a deer's and lets me walk on the highest places. For the music director: to be played on stringed instruments.
